summary: This is a July 10, 2008 letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida to defense attorney Jack Goldberger, providing formal notification of identified victims as required by the non-prosecution agreement with Jeffrey Epstein. It states that Epstein pleaded guilty to state charges on June 30, 2008, and that the U.S. agreed to defer federal prosecution, with a condition that identified victims retain certain rights. The letter serves to officially notify Epstein's attorneys of the list of individuals the U.S. was prepared to name as victims in a federal indictment.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the case; pleaded guilty to state charges of solicitation of prostitution and procurement of minors for prostitution on June 30, 2008, and was sentenced to imprisonment.

persons.name: Jack A. Goldberger
persons.context: The recipient of this letter; an attorney at Goldberger & Weiss, P.A., representing Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: R. Alexander Acosta
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of Florida who signed the letter, formally notifying Epstein's attorney of the identified victims.

connections.description: Goldberger is the attorney receiving official notification on behalf of his client, Jeffrey Epstein, as evidenced by the letter being addressed to him.
Acosta, as U.S. Attorney, is the prosecuting authority who entered into the non-prosecution agreement with Epstein and is providing formal notification related to that agreement.

events.title: Epstein's Guilty Plea and Sentencing
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty in Palm Beach County Circuit Court to felony solicitation of prostitution and procurement of minors for prostitution. He was sentenced to 12 months' imprisonment, followed by 6 months' imprisonment, then 12 months of community control.

events.title: Notification of Identified Victims
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office formally notifies Epstein's attorney, Jack Goldberger, of the individuals the U.S. was prepared to name as victims in a federal indictment, as required by the non-prosecution agreement.

locations: 15th Judicial Circuit in and for Palm Beach County
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to state charges on June 30, 2008, and was sentenced to a total of 18 months' imprisonment (12 months plus 6 months) followed by 12 months of community control.
The U.S. Department of Justice agreed to defer federal prosecution in favor of the state plea deal, subject to conditions outlined in a non-prosecution agreement.
A key condition of the agreement was that identified minor victims would retain rights to proceed under federal statute 18 U.S.C. ยง 2255 as if Epstein had been federally convicted.
This document is the U.S. Attorney's official notification to Epstein's attorney providing the list of individuals the U.S. was prepared to name as victims in a federal indictment.
The document is subject to a protective order, indicating confidentiality restrictions on its contents.
